Inputs:
Social Enterprise Restaurant
Community Services Center (CSC)
Community Partners + Resources
The Momentum Model
Internship + Program Design
Highly-Trained and Engaged Staff
Restaurant Skills Certifications
Assessments + Screening Tools
Playbook + Program Materials
Funding
Software + Technology
Transportation
Equipment, Tools + Goods
Paragraph description:
Café Momentum connects interns to community resources and services that help meet their basic needs and establish a baseline of stability in their lives. 

Resource and referral categories include housing, food assistance, health care, child care, government-issued or state identification, legal aid, substance abuse support, etc. This strategy also includes resource navigation education, critical document support, and providing interns with donated essential and personal care items.
Output:
Referrals provided by category
IDs obtained by youth
Immediate Outcomes <1year:
Increased access to basic needs
Increased access to basic needs
Intermediate Outcomes 1-5 years: Increased ability to navigate and use services
Long-term Outcomes (5-10+ years):
Improved well-being 
Increased personal agency 
Increased education attainment 
Increased economic success 
Avoid further justice system involvement

Paragraph description: Café Momentum provides mental health and healing support to their interns through mental health meetings and service planning, as well as individual and group therapy sessions. To provide holistic and trauma-informed care, each intern also participates in a Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) screening and a behavioral and emotional screening.
Output:
Mental health service plans 
Individual therapy sessions 
Group therapy sessions 
Behavioral screenings 
ACEs score (average)
Restorative circles
Immediate Outcomes <1year:
Improved social-emotional learning (SEL) skills 
Improved sense of belonging 
Improved interpersonal and planning skills
Intermediate Outcomes 1-5 years:
Increase in healthy relationships 
Increased education attainment 
Increased certification attainment

Paragraph description:
Café Momentum supports life skills and personal development by providing interns with workshops on conflict management, financial education, sexual health and healthy relationships, transferable workplace skills, restaurant industry skills, personal development and more.

Interns receive one-on-one support from a case manager to set personal goals and help monitor their completion of Café Momentum’s Tiers of Success.Through family visits, Café Momentum connects and promotes program awareness among interns’ family members. During this visit, case managers may also gain insights on intern and family needs. 

Café Momentum also coordinates enrichment activities for youth that expand their cultural and community understandings. These include visiting museums, galleries, performances, historical sites and colleges.
Output:
Case management 
Enrichment activities 
Tiers of Success completed 
Wages earned on key learning activities (average)
Immediate Outcomes <1year:
Improved social-emotional learning (SEL) skills 
Improved sense of belonging
Increased sense of belonging
Expanded professional network  
Increased employability
Intermediate Outcomes 1-5 years:
Increase in healthy relationships
Increased social capital
Increased certification attainment 
Enrolled, employed, or enlisted after high school

Paragraph description: Once enrolled in the program, Café Momentum supports interns to ensure they are attending high school or the equivalent. This is a required part of their internship. Café Momentum supports academic progress by providing interns with education planning services, enrollment assistance, attendance tracking, tutoring, and post-secondary prep (e.g., test prep, college application support, scholarship and FAFSA support, interview prep, college tours, etc.). In some cities, interns can choose to attend Café Momentum Academy, an accredited online high school program.
Output:
Interns enrolled in high school or GED program (percentage of)
Interns making academic progress
Intermediate Outcomes 1-5 years:
Increased education attainment 
Increased certification attainment 
Decrease in chronic absenteeism

Paragraph description: Café Momentum trains interns in all nine stations of a fine-dining restaurant, both back and front of house. From this training, interns earn Café Momentum restaurant skills certifications and industry-recognized certifications (e.g., ServSafe Food Handlers).
Output:
ServSafe certifications 
Station certifications earned 
Café Momentum skills certifications earned 
Paid hours
Wages earned on shift at Restaurant (average)
Immediate Outcomes <1year:
Improved sense of belonging
Improved interpersonal and planning skills 
Increased employability
Intermediate Outcomes 1-5 years: Enrolled, employed, or enlisted after high school

Paragraph description: Café Momentum promotes job attainment through career exploration activities such as informational interviews, job shadows, externships, etc. Interns also participate in job search workshops (e.g., resume drafting, interview training, professional communications, etc.) and receive one-on-one coaching. Café Momentum also coordinates professional networking opportunities for interns (e.g., guest speakers, tours, etc.)
Output:
Externships completed 
Job shadows completed 
Informational interviews 
Jobs attained 
Starting wage (average) 
Professional connections
Immediate Outcomes <1year:
Expanded professional network  
Improved interpersonal and planning skills 
Improved sense of belonging
Intermediate Outcomes 1-5 years:
Increased social capital
Increased certification attainment 
Enrolled, employed, or enlisted after high school

Paragraph description: Café Momentum provides all interns with violence prevention education, transportation planning, and de-escalation, conflict mediation and restorative practices.
Immediate Outcomes <1year:
Improved interpersonal and planning skills 
Improved interpersonal and planning skills 
Sense of safety at Café Momentum
Intermediate Outcomes 1-5 years:
Increase in healthy relationships 
Avoid justice system involvement

Paragraph description: Café Momentum assists interns with exiting the justice system. Activities include coordinating and monitoring community service or “Give Back Hours,” court and trial support, and staff relationship-building with probation officers. Café Momentum also provides transition planning and one-on-one case management support to ensure interns are meeting probation requirements.
Output:
Youth in compliance with probation (percentage)
Youth in alignment with restitution 
Community service hours completed
Staff court appearances 
Staff-probation officer relationships
Immediate Outcomes <1year:
Improved sense of belonging 
Progress towards justice system exit

Paragraph description: Café Momentum maintains and strengthens connections with interns by providing post-internship planning and outreach and follow-up after program exit. Interns may continue to benefit from the program after exit by receiving referrals and job search assistance, and by attending community-building activities and events.
Output:
Interns exiting program 
Interns enrolled in education program at exit 
Interns employed at exit 
Post-internship engagements 
Referrals provided 
Community-building activities and events
Immediate Outcomes <1year:
Expanded professional network  
Increased sense of belonging
Increased access to basic needs
Intermediate Outcomes 1-5 years:
Increased social capital
Enrolled, employed, or enlisted after high school
Increased certification attainment
